intro: Hieracium axillifrons, commonly known as the fringeless hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium axillifrons is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
